column1: Ichthyosis vulgaris is a skin disorder passed down through families that leads to dry, scaly skin.
Ichthyosis vulgaris is one of the most common of the inherited skin disorders.
People with this condition may also have many fine lines on the palm of the hand.
Your provider may tell you to use hydrating-moisturizing creams that contain keratolytic chemicals such as lactic acid, salicylic acid, and urea.
